DefiningCitation: J. (1992). Reliability and validity of a depression rating scale for schizophrenics. Schizophrenia Research
Calgary Depression Scale.Definition: The CDSS is an assessment of depression in schizophrenia. It has been extensively evaluated in both relapsed and remitted patients and appears sensitive to change. In comparison to the Hamilton Depression Scale, it has fewer factors and less overlap with positive and negative symptoms. This lack of overlap is present both at the time of relapse and at the time of remission
